statement.tex: \text{Find the integral of the function}\\ \sin ^4 x

step.context: \text{Are the following calculations and analysis correct?}
step.tex:
\begin{align} \sin ^4 x &= \sin^2 x \cdot \sin^2 x \\ &= \left( \dfrac{1 - \cos 2x}{2} \right) \left( \dfrac{1 - \cos 2 x}{2}\right) \\ &= \dfrac{1}{4} (1 - \cos 2x)^2 \\ &= \dfrac{1}{4} [1 + \cos^2 2x - 2 \cos 2x] \\ &= \dfrac{1}{4} \left[ \dfrac{3}{2}+ \dfrac{1}{2}\cos 4x - 2 \cos 2x \right] \\
\therefore \int \sin ^4 x \, dx &= \int \dfrac{1}{4} \left[ \dfrac{3}{2}+ \dfrac{1}{2}\cos 4x - 2 \cos 2x \right] \,dx \end{align}
